bg.x2d

Class Local

  • java.lang.Object
    • bg.x2d.Local

  • public abstract class Local
extends Object
    A convenience class consisting entirely of static methods regarding system information. Many of these methods simply mirror the System.getProperty method in Java's standard package. This class also deals with how 2DX loads and handles native libraries. By default, 2DX loads native code from the natives JAR file in the classpath. Inside of this JAR, each platform specific directory must exist in order to be counted as supported. Any platforms which do not have an existing directory within the native library location will not be listed as supported by the 2DX-GL software distribution. The native library location shouldn't change, but a setter method is provided in case it must be changed programmatically. Changes to the default library location should be made to the default value of the 'nativeLib' member of this class.
    Since:
    2DX 1.0 (1st Edition)

      • getJavaVersion

      • minJavaVersion

        public static boolean minJavaVersion(int v1,
                     int v2)
        Checks to see if the current Java Runtime's version is at or higher than the given minimum. The two arguments stand for the two parts of the version ID (excluding version updates). i.e. Java 1.7 or higher can be checked with minJavaVersion(1,7).
        Parameters:
        v1 - the first part of the version ID
        v2 - the second part of the version ID
        Returns:
        true if the Java Runtime's version meets the supplied minimum.

      • getJavaArch

        public static String getJavaArch()
        Returns the architecture of the current VM (32 or 64 bit)
        Returns:
        a String value representing the architecture: JVM_X64 constant if 64-bit, JVM_X86 constant otherwise.

      • getGraphicsDevice

        public static String getGraphicsDevice()
                                throws UnsatisfiedLinkError
        Attempts to determine the human-readable identifier of the graphics device installed on this machine. Usually this method returns the name of the installed video hardware responsible for handling VGA output. The exact model/name returned may vary depending on the underlying OS.
        Throws:
        UnsatisfiedLinkError - if 2DX does not support native libraries on the current platform

      • getSystemAvailableRAM

        public static long getSystemAvailableRAM()
                                  throws UnsatisfiedLinkError
        Fetches the amount of RAM the system has available. As opposed to the built in Java functions, this method obtains the amount of free RAM system-wide, outside of the virtual machine.
        Returns:
        free system RAM in bytes, or -1 if an error occurred.
        Throws:
        UnsatisfiedLinkError - if 2DX does not support native libraries on the current platform

      • getSystemTotalRAM

        public static long getSystemTotalRAM()
                              throws UnsatisfiedLinkError
        Fetches the total amount of RAM installed on the system. As opposed to the built in Java functions, this method obtains the total amount of RAM installed on the hardware. The accuracy of the result may vary depending on the platform.
        Returns:
        total system installed RAM in bytes, or -1 if an error occurred.
        Throws:
        UnsatisfiedLinkError - if 2DX does not support native libraries on the current platform

      • getProcessId

        public static int getProcessId()
                        throws UnsatisfiedLinkError
        Returns:
        the underlying OS identifier for the current process
        Throws:
        UnsatisfiedLinkError - if 2DX does not support native libraries on the current platform

      • getJVMAllocatedMemory

        public static long getJVMAllocatedMemory()
        Returns:
        the total amount of memory the JVM has allocated in bytes

      • getJVMUsedMemory

        public static long getJVMUsedMemory()
        Returns:
        the total amount of memory the JVM has actually used in bytes

      • getNativeLibrarySuffix

        public static String getNativeLibrarySuffix()
        Returns:
        the file suffix for shared libraries on the native platform (no '.') or "lib" if unknown.

      • setNativeLibraryLocation

        public static boolean setNativeLibraryLocation(String pathLoc)
        Sets the location on the classpath from which native libraries should be loaded from. This method automatically calls checkNativeSupport after setting the new variable.
        Parameters:
        pathLoc - the name of the package from which native code should be loaded
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • getNativeLibraryLocation

        public static String getNativeLibraryLocation()

      • getNativeLibraryPlatform

        public static String getNativeLibraryPlatform()
        Returns the current platform's directory name for native libraries. Used both by 2DX native libraries and third party native dependencies.
        Returns:

      • isNativeCodeSupported

        public static boolean isNativeCodeSupported()

      • addToLibPath

        public static void addToLibPath(String s)
                         throws IOException
        Adds the given path string to the "java.library.path" system property. This method is sort of a hack, as it utilizes Java Reflections to set an field used internally in the java.lang.ClassLoader system class. This allows the original path variable loaded at runtime to be changed, as well as setting the external system property.
        Parameters:
        s -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • loadNative

        public static boolean loadNative(String name)
        Loads the specified library into the system. The native library is located via the system class loader and written to a temporary file before being loaded into the system.
        Parameters:
        native - library name (no extension or path).
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise.
